workflow.name: Automate invoice processing with OCR.Space, GPT-4 & Google Drive to Gmail
workflow.description:
# How it works
- Watches a Google Drive folder for new (scanned) invoices. Each new file automatically triggers the workflow.
- Downloads and processes each invoice through OCR Space to extract the text.
- Extracts the company name (e.g. from the ‚Äúbilled to‚Äù field) and uses an AI agent to cross-reference it against a database in Google Sheets.
- If a match is found, retrieves the correct recipient email and sends the invoice as an attachment.
- If no match or an error occurs, the workflow alerts an operator by email for manual review.


## Setting up the workflow

1. Connect Google Drive
	‚Ä¢	In n8n, connect your Google Drive account.
	‚Ä¢	Create or select a folder where you will upload scanned invoices.

2. Connect Gmail (or another email service)
	‚Ä¢	Add your Gmail account as a credential in n8n.
	‚Ä¢	This will be used to send the processed invoice to the correct recipient.

3. Set up OCR.Space
	‚Ä¢	Create a free OCR.Space account: https://ocr.space
	‚Ä¢	In n8n, create a Generic Credential (Header Auth).
	‚Ä¢	Use apikey as the name and your OCR API key as the value.

4. Connect the AI Agent
	‚Ä¢	Add your OpenAI API key as a credential in n8n.
	‚Ä¢	The AI Agent will extract the company name from the invoice text and match it against your database.
	‚Ä¢	If a match is found, it retrieves the correct email.

5. Prepare the Google Sheet database
	‚Ä¢	Make a copy of the database sheet: Google Sheet Template
	‚Ä¢	Fill it with company names and recipient emails.
	‚Ä¢	Connect your Google account to n8n and link this sheet to the workflow.

6. Run the workflow
	‚Ä¢	When a new invoice is uploaded to your Google Drive folder, the workflow will:
	‚Ä¢	Extract the text with OCR.Space
	‚Ä¢	Use the AI Agent to identify the company name
	‚Ä¢	Cross-reference it with your Google Sheet database
	‚Ä¢	Send the invoice automatically to the correct recipient via Gmail
	‚Ä¢	If no match is found, an error email is sent to you for manual review

documentId.cachedResultName: list of company names and emails

options.systemMessage:
=You will receive a company name as plain text.

Your task is to:
	1.	Cross-reference the given name against a Google Sheet database.
	2.	The database contains two columns: Company Name and Email.
	3.	Perform a case-insensitive search to find an exact match for the company name.
	4.	If a match is found, return a JSON object 
{
  "company_name": "Matched Company Name",
  "email": "matched@email.com"
}

5. If no match is found, return a JSON object with an error message:
{
  "error": "Company not found in the database."
}

parameters.message: The error in the workflow pertains to the attached document.  Please check if it has not been sent and manually send it.  Also check the database to make sure the name of the corresponding company is in the database.

parameters.content: ### Here we set a google drive folder, where any time an invoice is added, the automation will be triggered automatically
### Here we loop over the items, because we may have more than 1 invoice placed in the folder
### Here we download the invoice to pass it on to the OCR from ocr space

# Setting up the workflow

## 1. Connect google drive to your account, and create a folder that will serve as the input. 

## 2.  Connect your Gmail account to n8n. 

## 3. Create an OCR space account (free). For the authentication, choose Generic Credential Type, then Header Auth. In the Header Auth, create new credential, with the Name as apikey and the Value as YOUR-API-KEY

## 4. Connect your preferred LLM credentials, and connect it to the AI Agent

## 5. Create a copy of the Google Sheet Database, fill it with your list and connect it to the AI Agent

# OCR Space: https://ocr.space

# Google Sheet Database: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1M0sS7KZzOn9Bu8Dy0lcrh2jWqVkLa0qFQfki1jecxeE/edit?usp=sharing (Make a copy)

# Workflow Summary: This workflow takes in from a google drive folder, scanned pdf invoices. The workflow then extracts the text from the file using OCR space. Once the text is returned, the AI agent cross references the company name, with the database (excel sheet) to find the company name and the email of the recipient in the company. If it is found the email is sent with the invoice attached.
### Here we are sending the downloaded file to OCR space, and getting the extracted information from the invoice
### Extracting company name. In this case after the billed to:
### AI Agent cross references name with Database and returns the recipients email address
### If we have any errors, we send an email to the operator for manual review
### If we have any errors, we send an email to the operator for manual review
### Send email to recipient with the invoice attached

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
